template.name: HashiCorp Consul Node by HTTP
template.description:
Get HashiCorp Consul Node metrics by HTTP agent from metrics endpoint.
Don't forget to change macros {$CONSUL.NODE.API.URL}, {$CONSUL.TOKEN}. Some metrics may not be collected depending on your HashiCorp Consul instance version and configuration. More information about metrics you can find in official documentation: https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/telemetry
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback
Template tooling version used: 0.42

item.name: Consul: ACL: resolves, rate
item.description: The number of ACL resolves per second.

item.name: Consul: Catalog: deregister, rate
item.description: The number of catalog deregister operation per second.

item.name: Consul: Catalog: register, rate
item.description: The number of catalog register operation per second.

item.name: Consul: Number of checks
item.description: Number of checks on current node.

item.name: Consul: Number of check monitors
item.description: Number of check monitors on current node.

item.name: Consul: Client RPC, per second
item.description: Number of times per second whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server. This gives a measure of how much a given agent is loading the Consul servers. This is only generated by agents in client mode, not Consul servers.

item.name: Consul: Client RPC failed ,per second
item.description: Number of times per second whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server and fails.

item.name: Consul: Process CPU seconds, total
item.description: Total user and system CPU time spent in seconds.

item.name: Consul: GC pause, p50
item.description: The 50 percentile (median) for the number of nanoseconds consumed by stop-the-world garbage collection (GC) pauses since Consul started, in milliseconds.

item.name: Consul: GC pause, p90
item.description: The 90 percentile for the number of nanoseconds consumed by stop-the-world garbage collection (GC) pauses since Consul started, in milliseconds.

item.name: Consul: Get local services
item.description: Get all the services that are registered with the local agent and their status.

item.name: Consul: Get local services check
item.description: Data collection check.

trigger.name: Consul: Failed to get local services
trigger.description: Failed to get local services. Check debug log for more information.

item.name: Consul: Get instance metrics
item.description: Get raw metrics from Consul instance /metrics endpoint.

item.name: Consul: Get node info
item.description: Get configuration and member information of the local agent.

item.name: Consul: Goroutine count
item.description: The number of Goroutines on Consul instance.

item.name: Consul: KV store: apply, p50
item.description: The 50 percentile (median) for the time it takes to complete an update to the KV store.

item.name: Consul: KV store: apply, p90
item.description: The 90 percentile for the time it takes to complete an update to the KV store.

item.name: Consul: KV store: apply, rate
item.description: The number of updates to the KV store per second.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: degraded
item.description: This metric counts the number of times the Consul agent has performed failure detection on another agent at a slower probe rate. The agent uses its own health metric as an indicator to perform this action. If its health score is low, it means that the node is healthy, and vice versa.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: gossip, p90
item.description: The 90 percentile for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: gossip, p50
item.description: The 50 for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: health score
item.description: This metric describes a node's perception of its own health based on how well it is meeting the soft real-time requirements of the protocol. This metric ranges from 0 to 8, where 0 indicates "totally healthy".

trigger.name: Consul: Node's health score is critical
trigger.event_name: Consul: Node's health score is over {$CONSUL.NODE.HEALTH_SCORE.MAX.HIGH}
trigger.description: This metric ranges from 0 to 8, where 0 indicates "totally healthy". This health score is used to scale the time between outgoing probes, and higher scores translate into longer probing intervals. For more details see section IV of the Lifeguard paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1707.00788.pdf

trigger.name: Consul: Node's health score is warning
trigger.event_name: Consul: Node's health score is too high (over {$CONSUL.NODE.HEALTH_SCORE.MAX.WARN} for 3m)
trigger.description: This metric ranges from 0 to 8, where 0 indicates "totally healthy". This health score is used to scale the time between outgoing probes, and higher scores translate into longer probing intervals. For more details see section IV of the Lifeguard paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1707.00788.pdf

dependency.name: Consul: Node's health score is critical

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: msg alive
item.description: This metric counts the number of alive Consul agents, that the agent has mapped out so far, based on the message information given by the network layer.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: msg dead
item.description: This metric counts the number of times a Consul agent has marked another agent to be a dead node.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: msg suspect
item.description: The number of times a Consul agent suspects another as failed while probing during gossip protocol.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: probe node, p50
item.description: The 50 percentile (median) for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select Consul agent.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: probe node, p90
item.description: The 90 percentile for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select Consul agent.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: push pull node, p50
item.description: The 50 percentile (median) for the number of Consul agents that have exchanged state with this agent.

item.name: Consul: Memberlist: push pull node, p90
item.description: The 90 percentile for the number of Consul agents that have exchanged state with this agent.

item.name: Consul: TCP connections, accepted per second
item.description: This metric counts the number of times a Consul agent has accepted an incoming TCP stream connection per second.

item.name: Consul: TCP connections, per second
item.description: This metric counts the number of times a Consul agent has initiated a push/pull sync with an other agent per second.

item.name: Consul: TCP send bytes, per second
item.description: This metric measures the total number of bytes sent by a Consul agent through the TCP protocol per second.

item.name: Consul: UDP received bytes, per second
item.description: This metric measures the total number of bytes received by a Consul agent through the UDP protocol per second.

item.name: Consul: UDP sent bytes, per second
item.description: This metric measures the total number of bytes sent by a Consul agent through the UDP protocol per second.

item.name: Consul: Open file descriptors, max
item.description: Maximum number of open file descriptors.

item.name: Consul: Open file descriptors
item.description: Number of open file descriptors.

item.name: Consul: RSS memory usage
item.description: Resident memory size in bytes.

item.name: Consul: Role
item.description: Role of current Consul agent.

item.name: Consul: Serf member: failed, rate
item.description: Increments when an agent is marked dead. This can be an indicator of overloaded agents, network problems, or configuration errors where agents cannot connect to each other on the required ports. Shown as events per second.

item.name: Consul: Serf member: flap, rate
item.description: Increments when an agent is marked dead and then recovers within a short time period. This can be an indicator of overloaded agents, network problems, or configuration errors where agents cannot connect to each other on the required ports. Shown as events per second.

item.name: Consul: Serf member: join, rate
item.description: Increments when an agent joins the cluster. If an agent flapped or failed this counter also increments when it re-joins. Shown as events per second.

item.name: Consul: Serf member: left, rate
item.description: Increments when an agent leaves the cluster. Shown as events per second.

item.name: Consul: Serf member: update, rate
item.description: Increments when a Consul agent updates. Shown as events per second.

item.name: Consul: Number of services
item.description: Number of services on current node.

item.name: Consul: Snapshot: append line, p50
item.description: The 50 percentile (median) for the time taken by the Consul agent to append an entry into the existing log.

item.name: Consul: Snapshot: append line, p90
item.description: The 90 percentile for the time taken by the Consul agent to append an entry into the existing log.

item.name: Consul: Snapshot: append line, rate
item.description: The number of snapshot appendLine operations per second.

item.name: Consul: Snapshot: compact, p50
item.description: The 50 percentile (median) for the time taken by the Consul agent to compact a log. This operation occurs only when the snapshot becomes large enough to justify the compaction.

item.name: Consul: Snapshot: compact, p90
item.description: The 90 percentile for the time taken by the Consul agent to compact a log. This operation occurs only when the snapshot becomes large enough to justify the compaction.

item.name: Consul: Snapshot: compact, rate
item.description: The number of snapshot compact operations per second.

item.name: Consul: Version
item.description: Version of Consul agent.

trigger.expression: last(/HashiCorp Consul Node by HTTP/consul.version,#1)<>last(/HashiCorp Consul Node by HTTP/consul.version,#2) and length(last(/HashiCorp Consul Node by HTTP/consul.version))>0
trigger.name: Consul: Version has been changed
trigger.description: Consul version has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Consul: Virtual memory size
item.description: Virtual memory size in bytes.

discovery_rule.name: HTTP API methods discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery HTTP API methods specific metrics.

item_prototype.name: Consul: HTTP request: ["{#HTTP_METHOD}"], p50
item_prototype.description: The 50 percentile (median) of how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb.

item_prototype.name: Consul: HTTP request: ["{#HTTP_METHOD}"], p90
item_prototype.description: The 90 percentile of how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb.

item_prototype.name: Consul: HTTP request: ["{#HTTP_METHOD}"], rate
item_prototype.description: Thr number of HTTP request for the given verb per second.

discovery_rule.name: Local node services discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discover metrics for services that are registered with the local agent.

item_prototype.name: Consul: ["{#SERVICE_NAME}"]: Aggregated status
item_prototype.description: Aggregated values of all health checks for the service instance.

trigger_prototype.name: Consul: Aggregated status is 'critical'
trigger_prototype.event_name: Consul: Node's health score is over {$CONSUL.NODE.HEALTH_SCORE.MAX.HIGH}
trigger_prototype.description: Aggregated state of service on the local agent is 'critical'.

trigger_prototype.name: Consul: Aggregated status is 'warning'
trigger_prototype.description: Aggregated state of service on the local agent is 'warning'.

item_prototype.name: Consul: ["{#SERVICE_NAME}"]: Check ["{#SERVICE_CHECK_NAME}"]: Output
item_prototype.description: Current output of health check for the service.

item_prototype.name: Consul: ["{#SERVICE_NAME}"]: Check ["{#SERVICE_CHECK_NAME}"]: Status
item_prototype.description: Current state of health check for the service.

discovery_rule.name: Raft leader metrics discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discover raft metrics for leader nodes.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Autopilot healthy
item_prototype.description: Tracks the overall health of the local server cluster. 1 if all servers are healthy, 0 if one or more are unhealthy.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: commit time, p50
item_prototype.description: The 50 percentile (median) time it takes to commit a new entry to the raft log on the leader, in milliseconds.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: commit time, p90
item_prototype.description: The 90 percentile time it takes to commit a new entry to the raft log on the leader, in milliseconds.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: commit, rate
item_prototype.description: The number of commits a new entry to the Raft log on the leader per second.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: dispatch log, p50
item_prototype.description: The 50 percentile (median) time it takes for the leader to write log entries to disk, in milliseconds.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: dispatch log, p90
item_prototype.description: The 90 percentile time it takes for the leader to write log entries to disk, in milliseconds.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: dispatch log, rate
item_prototype.description: The number of times a Raft leader writes a log to disk per second.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: leader last contact, p50
item_prototype.description: The 50 percentile (median) of how long it takes a leader node to communicate with followers during a leader lease check, in milliseconds.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: leader last contact, p90
item_prototype.description: The 90 percentile of how long it takes a leader node to communicate with followers during a leader lease check, in milliseconds.

discovery_rule.name: Raft server metrics discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discover raft metrics for server nodes.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft: apply, rate
item_prototype.description: Incremented whenever a leader first passes a message into the Raft commit process (called an Apply operation). This metric describes the arrival rate of new logs into Raft per second.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: candidate
item_prototype.description: The number of initiated leader elections.

item_prototype.name: Consul: Raft state: leader
item_prototype.description: Increments when a server becomes a leader.

macro.description: Filter of discoverable discovered services on local node.
Filter to exclude discovered services on local node.
Filter of discoverable discovered service by namespace on local node. Enterprise only, in case of Open Source version Namespace will be set to 'None'.
Filter to exclude discovered service by namespace on local node. Enterprise only, in case of Open Source version Namespace will be set to 'None'.
Maximum acceptable value of node's health score for AVERAGE trigger expression.
Maximum acceptable value of node's health score for WARNING trigger expression.
Maximum percentage of used file descriptors.

trigger.expression: min(/HashiCorp Consul Node by HTTP/consul.process_open_fds,5m)/last(/HashiCorp Consul Node by HTTP/consul.process_max_fds)*100>{$CONSUL.OPEN.FDS.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Consul: Current number of open files is too high
trigger.event_name: Consul: Current number of open files is too high (over {$CONSUL.OPEN.FDS.MAX.WARN}% for 5m)
trigger.description: "Heavy file descriptor usage (i.e., near the processs file descriptor limit) indicates a potential file descriptor exhaustion issue."
